title: Process I—Part III
description: The intensive study of the dramatic and fictional work of Anton Chekhov and an actor’s approach to that work. This course includes many of the techniques begun in earlier classes and applies them to this material. Also included is a study of Chekhov’s short stories and plays, and the course involves adapting and staging these works. Third course of a three-course sequence. Prerequisites: TDGR 210B and admission to the MFA program or consent of instructor.
